comments.body: a new dimension would be so cool! my idea is that when you kill the warden you get the skulk heart. then you craft the skulk flame which is crafted using the skulk heart, a skulk shard, and the skulk catalyst. then you can light the big portal in the ancient city. only then you can enter the skulk dimension where you can find all kinds of skulk blocks items and mobs! maybe even a new ore! thanks for reading!

This is a bad idea, it was recently added in minecraft 1.20.30 and it is way too loud!! Instead it should be a bit more of a quiet splash, one still easily heard and requires anything that can make the sound to do so based on velocity. Basically this sound can only be made when anything is dropped or falls from 30 blocks or more. It would also be great if sounds like this could have individual volumes set by the player, this way they are not ear-busting loud. Or just set the volume of all water sounds, the only problem with that is i still want to hear the other water sounds, just not this one.. busting my eardrums is not my idea of a good time!

what do u mean it's a bad idea? u just said the problem is the sound, so it's not a bad idea! omg who would say it's a bad idea it's the coolest thing! for lava too, lava splash would be awsome. idk why mojang doesnt say anything about it

Translation of previous comment: After you posted, I thought it was a good idea! Finding secrets in such an ancient and mysterious place is SO atmospheric.

To go with something fantastical, make it a different take on how groundcover plants actually work irl by having it be a single, distinct, perhaps lotus inspirer flower with a sprawling root network covering the top face of its grass block. These roots quickly transition from its darkened base to a thin, organic web, that matches the color of the flower, providing a smooth transition from flower to the affected, hue shifted grass blocks when bonemealed. I would love to see these come in all the usual, vibrant colors, but that would also make it quite the gamble to actually get the specific color of flower you want from the sniffers.

Posts must contain content. Empty posts are spam.
That would be imbalanced. Trims are intentionally cosmetic and won't offer gameplay advantages.
Trims are too expensive for just cosmetic purposes.

But the "Thing" banner pattern is also expensive. Fashion in Minecraft, like in real life, can be ridiculously expensive with little to no functional benefit.

Plus, it'd defeat the purpose of having only gold armor, one of the least durable armors in the game, be usable to pacify piglins. Though I admit it would be a cool goal for players to work toward, I think it'd go against the design philosophy the developers had intended.

Although this does completely and utterly kill the idea of wearing gold in the nether being an intentional player nerf by Mojang, if this suggested feature wasn‚Äôt added it would be quite the inconsistency with pigmen.

I love the idea of adding more instruments to Minecraft, especially when it‚Äôs an instrument I have made by hand before! In my opinion, the recipe is too easy, but I also can‚Äôt think of another way to craft the flute. Maybe it could be an item you find in jungle temples as there‚Äôs currently no unique items for the jungle temples.
It should be called the pan flute. One should be able to customize the music it plays, possibly by sneak-clicking it.
They also should appeal to Irish cultures
Asian cultures weren‚Äôt the only ones that culturally used flute like instruments‚Ä¶ African Cultures did as well as Native American cultures‚Ä¶
Someone had an idea like this, but which I found better, it's that this sound is hearable when you use a note block which is on bamboo !!!
Someone had an idea like this, but which I found better, it's that this sound is hearable when you use a note block which is on bamboo !!!

Regarding a comment, there is already a flute sound for note blocks for certain blocks; yes, I agree this could be extended to the Bamboo Block. Bamboo Flute would serve to resemble a sound closer to Goat Horns than Note Blocks.

I really like this! The bamboo flute would be a great alternative for players who may be easily startled by the goat horns, and with more instruments, players would be able to potentially play some kind of music together in the future?

I like the idea that the flute could play all kinds of melodies, not just Asian music. While I understand the desire to have that representation, especially as it is a bamboo flute, I think it fits more with Minecraft‚Äôs style to have flute music that relates to existing in-game sounds or incorporates flute music from a variety of cultures.
